If $M$ has a smooth structure, show that it has uncountably many distinct ones. I tried to define $\psi'=F_s\circ\psi$ and hope $\{(U, \psi')\}$ to form a new atlas for $M$. But 
$$\varphi'\circ(\psi')^{-1}=F_s\circ\varphi\circ\psi^{-1}\circ F_s^{-1}$$
may not be diffeomorphism. Any help, thanks.
